name: The Breakers at Fort Walton Beach

reviews.text: We stayed in the west bldg in 401. Had a reservation for a 2 bedroom unit, was surprised with a 3/3 unit. Beautiful unit with tile thru out. Granite counters in kitchen and everything you could need. The view is fantastic with sugar sand beach. I'm from SW FL and had know idea the beaches in the pan handle were so pretty. No shells, but the sand is fantastic!!!! Can't wait to visit again........Will definitely stay here......
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: We stayed here two nights in unit C-309 at the Breakers. We did not have a reservation and walked in about 9am and spoke with the ladies at the front desk. They were pleasant and professional and let us look at two different units. We liked the first unit as well and then checked on the second one and said this is it. All tile throughout the unit. The bedrooms had carpet. The master shower was huge with two shower heads and the second bathroom was in the hallway. The unit was clean and had an excellent view of the Gulf. With our stay we had two complimentary chairs and umbrella with the reservation which were just great for relaxation! The Kitchen had all accessories you might need and had a full fridge. There is a big dining room and the unit itself had a fantastic layout. I would highly recommend this unit for a family of four, although you can hit the pull out sleeper for 6 if need be. Would stay here again if I am in the area. The pools are heated as well and they have a free DVD rental box for the stay duration as well.
reviews.title: Wonderful condo/unit C-309

reviews.text: The location is perfect, right on the beach and close to all attractions. Our room was in the west building on the 6th floor. There was never a wait for an elevator and the noise level was low for spring break. The room was very clean and had a fully furnished kitchen. The pool was cool but inviting. I would recommend this place to anyone. The only thing I saw that could be improved upon was the front desk staff. They were not very informative about the area and could not really recommend anywhere to dine or shop.
reviews.title: Great View, Perfect Location

reviews.text: This was the greatest little condo. Perfect for us for a few days during spring break. I actually wish we could have stayed longer. The mattress in this condo was the best ever too. We slept really well. Thanks for a great stay. Would love to come again soon.
reviews.title: W 313 is great.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Breakers for Spring break and it was wonderful! This is our fourth time staying here and let me say you will never be able to find a more georgeous view and beach area. The beaches are more quiet than Destin. Our son and his fiance, who were out of college for spring break, stayed here with us for the first time and they loved it. We were a little worried that the water would be too cool to enjoy, but it was warm enough to have fun in and the pools are heated. Our condo, which was C208 was beautifully decorated with comfortable king size pillow top bedding. It was stocked with any cooking utensils you could possibly need. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The beach attendant where chairs are provided each day knew our names and made us feel like family each day. Can't wait until we return here in July!
reviews.title: Another amazing trip!

reviews.text: Not ever having been to the area we only booked four nights, I wish we would of booked seven. It was so wonderful to look out of our master bedroom and living room and see such beautifulness every morning, evening, and all throughout the day! The view was absolutely gorgeous I can't say it enough! The first day of our stay was cloudy but our view of the ocean was still incredible. We saw dolphins in the ocean everyday, (bring a pair of binoculars). I enjoyed staying in Fort Walton instead of Destin because I don't like crowds. Although our condos were in a line of other condos on the beach, where we stayed did not seem to crowded with people. They say in the summer it does get a lot busier. We stayed in a spacious 3br/3b. All kitchen utensils and cook ware was provited and it was not old junky stuff. All you need to do is bring food, saran wrap etc. They have 4 propane grills and I think 4 charcoal, we used the propane. It's first come first serve. I think they even keep up with cleaning the grills b/c we were surprised it was so clean. We also received a free beach umbrella and 2 chairs everyday of our stay (if you need to rent more there is a charge). And we were given an adult pass to a dolphin cruise in Destin on the Southern Star. It was family friendly, we so enjoyed it and got to see several dolphins in the bay and out in the ocean. (ask about the complimentary adult pass to this one). The ticket for adults is 27. We enjoyed it. If you go on the dolphin cruise make sure you get there 30-45 min early because it gets crowded trying to get on the boat at last minute. For our last minute shopping we shopped at Publix grocery store about a mile away. I think next time we go I will do all my shopping there. It's a little more than wal-mart but it's so easy being right there and it has several different selections of all kinds of foods. I was impressed and I will shop there next time instead of toting food all the way from Tx! lol. There is also free movie rental at the condos. We stayed on the 5th floor. There is a pier two miles down the beach you can walk to or drive to. It cost 2. to walk out onto or you can pay 7.50 to fish. We didn't have fishing equipment, not sure but you probally could rent it. The peir is called Anglers. There is also a restaurant and bar at the Anglers and the beach surrounding looked congested so I would smile when I thought about heading back to my 'low key" condos at The Breakers. During spring break I would definatly recommend the Breakers at Fort Walton Beach because all the partiers are just not there. They are at Destin, or Panama City...
reviews.title: Beautiful View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the most incredible places I've ever stayed. Outstanding accommodations for an outstanding value. Entire 2 bed/2 bath condo finished in high end, modern decor. Large balcony with great view of ocean. Beach a little more secluded than some, which is what we were looking for. Good location to go into Fort Walton, Destin or Sandestin. In February, with cleaning fee and taxes included, only $133 per night. Cheaper than any hotel on the beach and so much more!!!
reviews.title: Amazing place to stay!

reviews.text: We stayed here in the middle of September 2011. Our family - a total of 9 people - stayed in one of the three bedroom condos. It's very spacious, there was plenty of room for all of us. My husband has stayed in many condos in different parts of Florida and he said this was the nicest he's ever stayed at. It was also less expensive than any he's stayed at. We had no complaints with our condo. It was so great to have a full kitchen and washer and dryer. It's very conveniently located, with lots of restaurants just a few minutes away. The balcony is so nice. I'm guessing the time of year we went had something to do with it, but we were amazed at how quiet the hotel and beach was. Maybe not for everyone, but great for us.
reviews.title: Very Happy With Stay
Room 601W
reviews.text: The beach is gorgeous, prettiest and softest sand I've ever seen - the only thing is there were tons of jellyfish! We were told that that's a pretty regular thing there. We stayed mostly out of the water because of the amount of jellyfish, but when the waves really started rolling there seemed to be fewer of them so we did finally get in without incident.

A few suggestions: if you want beach pictures, google gwynemark photography. They took pics in Destin and we absolutely LOVED them, Gwyne is wonderful to work with and was excellent with my toddler. He's super shy around strangers, will not get his picture taken in a studio and had a cold - you'd never know it from the pictures. I'm usually very frugal but it was worth every penny. We ate at Fish Lipz on our last night and I DO NOT recommend it. We had a horrible experience. Coach N Four - the restaurant itself nothing special and but the food was good. Fudpuckers - average touristy place, they encourage graffiti which is kind of cute, but there are markings on literally every surface of the restaurant which left me with the feeling that I needed to take a shower.
reviews.title: Love this place!!!!

reviews.text: Just stayed 3 nights at The Breakers and loved it! It was going into Memorial Day weekend and the beach wasn't too crowded. The condo #C214 was very nice and clean and nicely decorated. 1 1/2 baths made it nice. Updated kitchen with a washer and dryer made it feel like home. Loved having breakfast on the balcony each morning and taking in the view!! Free DVD rentals included and came in handy once the sun went down. Just a couple of disappointments that we we had, but they didn't really detract from the great time we had. First, they don't provide you beach towels. Wish I had known this going in. Second, they provide you with laundry, dish and hand soap, but they don't have shampoo and conditioner which we thought was odd. And no box of Kleenex in the room.
reviews.title: Great beachfront location!

reviews.text: We enjoyed the beach set up of 2 chairs and umbrella on the beach each day, but you need to get out early to get a good spot. The June grass wasn't too bad at this time. The water temp was very nice...cool but not cold. In the mornings the gulf was very flat but picked up some by the afternoon.
reviews.title: #W612 Wow!!! Wonderful Beachfront Condo

reviews.text: We really loved the Breakers and will return again. This was our first trip to the Destin/FWB area and really enjoyed it. The water and white sand is just amazing!!
reviews.title: Very nice and clean rooms

reviews.text: Stayed in condo # w612 on 5 day vacation. Beautifully clean condo, very quiet. large king size bed & very comfortable sleeper sofa. Very nice clean kitchen, washer, dryer, dishwasher in unit. Nice amenities, pools very clean, free movie rental. Front desk staff, very helpful and nice to deal with. Great value. Beautiful oeanfront balcony. Nice beach service- unit included free umbrella and 2 beach chairs set up for us each day of our stay. We would recommend to our friends, and we will stay here again.
reviews.title: W502

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Breakers. The rooms we had were spacious and very reasonably priced. We had a gulf front room with a balcony which was real nice to sit and hear the waves. The tennis court out front was fun to use and by staying there we got a free movie from a machine near the front desk that had a lot to choose from. The only improvement I think they could make is better lighting in the parking lot. There were lights, just not enough I think. One drawback to the area is we had to go a little ways to get to restaurants we like. I would recommend this motel and if I was in the area I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great condo located on a BEAUTIFUL beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four days here around Thanksgiving. It was our first time to the area. The condo was perfect. Great view!!!!! Our one-bedroom condo was very nice, nice furnishings, clean and perfect size. The breakers staff was helpful and efficient. We paid off-season prices so it was great and had great weather. We'd definitely go back. Great places around there.... Helen Back Cafe/Bar, Howl at Moon for some fun in Fort Walton. Tightlines and AJ's in Destin Harbour.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Perfect location to hit the pool and the beach. Quieter than Destin. The property is well kept and has all of the conviences of home. Do recommend a car, as there is not much to do in walking distance. About a mile / mile and a half from all grocery, gas, restaurants. Beach is beautiful! Would recommend and would visit again! Take advantage of the free golf, Dolphin boat, little nemo boat (geared for kids fishing) and chairs and umbrella on the beach. You get one free pass per paid person, per paid night. Make reservations in advance, as things book quickly. They off up to 3 free round trip people (per paid person) to and from the airport, but I found they ended up being more expensive( aprox $50) than just grabbing a taxi (approximately $38).
reviews.title: Will visit again

reviews.text: This will be my only destination when returning to Ft Walton Beach. Staff was great, rooms comfortable with plenty of amenities. We had the October rates which fit perfectly. I woudn't pay summer rates.
reviews.title: # 1 in Quality and Comfort for the price
Beautiful View!
reviews.text: Had a 3 bedroom 2 bath overlooking the beach. The view from the balcony and the master bedroom was unbelievable! What a way to wake up in the morning. The master bedroom was huge too! The condo was decorated very nicely and the kitchen was nice and had everything you could need including a washer and dryer. There was even free wireless in the room. They had a small snack shop by the pool and a fitness center. We will definitely go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Breakers and had a wonderful time there. What a nice place! The condo exceeded our expectations, and had everything needed to make it feel like our home away from home. And the view from the balcony was outstanding...
reviews.title: What a nice place!

aka: The Breakers Hotel Fort Walton Beach
